definition: to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: Many city vehicles have been adapted for use as school buses.
sentences.chinese: 许多市内交通车都被改造为校用专车。

sentences.english: There's an airport bus that goes into the city every hour.
sentences.chinese: 每小时都有一班机场交通车去市区，逢正点开出。

sentences.english: I got up too late to catch the early bus.
sentences.chinese: 我睡觉太晚了，没赶上早交通车。

sentences.english: But I'd suggest taking the limousine .
sentences.chinese: 可是我建议您乘机场的交通车。

sentences.english: There is a limousine service to the Friendship Hotel every day.
sentences.chinese: 每天有开往友谊宾馆的交通车办事。

definition: shuttle bus ferrying passengers between train stations on two different rail lines
shuttle bus (or train)/train or bus traveling only part of its normal route
public transportation/mass transit/abbr. for 公共交通[gong1 gong4 jiao1 tong1]
to take the car, bus, train etc
bus/abbr. for 公共汽車|公共汽车[gong1 gong4 qi4 che1]/car belonging to an organization and used by its members (government car, police car, company car etc)/abbr. for 公務用車|公务用车[gong1 wu4 yong4 che1]
to ride (in a car or carriage)/to drive/to motor
